statements: UPDATE performance_metrics SET value = 25.50 WHERE id = 1;
UPDATE performance_metrics SET metric_name = 'Errors', description = 'High error rate' WHERE id = 2;
UPDATE performance_metrics SET value = 15.75, description = 'Updated value for metric' WHERE id = 1;
UPDATE performance_metrics SET date_recorded = '2022-01-15', metric_name = 'New Metric' WHERE id = 2;
UPDATE KPIs SET kpi_value = 100.50, kpi_description = 'Updated KPI description' WHERE kpi_id = 1;
UPDATE Metrics SET metric_value = 75.25, metric_date = '2021-10-15' WHERE metric_name = 'Sales';
UPDATE KPIs SET kpi_value = 100.50, kpi_name = 'Updated KPI' WHERE kpi_id = 5;
UPDATE Metrics SET metric_value = metric_value * 1.1, metric_date = '2022-09-30' WHERE metric_id = 10;
UPDATE dashboard_metrics SET metric_value = 25.8 WHERE metric_name = 'Total Sales';
UPDATE user_metrics SET total_visits = 100, last_login = '2022-09-15 10:30:00' WHERE user_id = 123;
UPDATE dashboard_metrics SET metric_value = 123.45 WHERE metric_name = 'Sales';
UPDATE user_metrics SET total_visits = total_visits + 1, last_login = CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() WHERE user_id = 1001;
UPDATE kpi_metrics SET value = 100 WHERE id = 1
UPDATE dashboard_widgets SET widget_name = 'New Widget Name' WHERE widget_id = 2
UPDATE kpi_metrics SET value = 100.5 WHERE id = 1
UPDATE dashboard_widgets SET widget_data = '{"label": "Sales Performance"}' WHERE widget_id = 2
UPDATE dashboard_data SET kpi_value = 300 WHERE id = '42d8df7b-35dd-4c47-8d04-28b2709b568f';
UPDATE users SET role = 'admin', email = 'admin@example.com' WHERE user_id = 123;
UPDATE dashboard_data SET kpi_value = 100.5, timestamp = '2022-01-15 10:30:00' WHERE user_id = 123 AND kpi_name = 'Sales';
UPDATE users SET email = 'newemail@example.com', role = 'admin' WHERE user_id = 456;
